title: Ozark National Scenic Riverways: Freshwater Plants
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants     Freshwater Plants                Freshwater Plants         Pickerel Weed can be found in backwaters and sloughs        (Missouri Dept of Conservation Photo)  Ozark Springs provide habitat for many species of aquatic plants. The ivy leaved duckweed is found in Alley and Round Spring, yet is rare statewide. Watercress is abundant in all the springs, and coontail provides habitat for fish in the rivers. Pickerel weed, sweet flag and other species can be found in backwaters and sloughs along the river.
